item.title: [Outreach] Bat Talk at Max Planck for Brain Research
item.author: Author
item.description: I was delighted to give a talk to PhD students and postdocs at the Max Planck for Brain Research’s Halloween Party last Friday. Bats play a significant role in the folklore and mythology of many cultures. In the West, their image is almost synonymous with all that is dark, spooky, ominous, and unknown. There’s hardly any Halloween shop or party or setting that doesn’t in some way feature these furry flying friends.

item.title: [Outreach] Skype a Scientist: Talking to 4th Grades about bats
item.author: Author
item.description: I had a great time talking to a couple classes of 4th graders yesterday about bats. As part of the online scientist-teacher matching program, #SkypeaScientist, I linked up with Mrs. Phaedra Taft at an elementary school in Connecticut. We talked about bat ecology, their hearing and vocal abilities, and their natural history. It’s been a while since I’ve spoken to 4th graders and I was pleasantly surprised at their sophistication of their questions.
